noun.description: A punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract.
examples: the charge carries a maximum penalty of ten years' imprisonment

noun.description: (in sports and games) a disadvantage or handicap imposed on a player or team, typically for infringement of rules.

phrases: he ordered enterprises to fulfill contracts under penalty of strict fines
Married women weren't even allowed to watch under penalty of death.
Voter registrants have to check a box and sign a form under penalty of perjury that they are a U.S. citizen, of voting age, and not an ex-felon.
There wasn't a soul in the room who would have considered such a move under penalty of death.
In the survey, college administrators were asked to state, under penalty of perjury, whether they enrolled high-school students in the classes legally.
origin: Early 16th century: probably via Anglo-Norman French, from medieval Latin poenalitas, based on poena pain.
